title: If someone simulated my mind in a computer while I was alive, would I experience both? - Quora

response.answer_text: I strongly doubt it, unless you also experience Google’s activity when it tries to predict what you plan to enter in the search bar. That is a computer simulation of your mind, it's just not a very accurate one. Computer simulations have no mystical connection to their simulated object, they are simply some calculations that produce a result you can interpret as an estimate of its behavior.

If a perfect copy were made of you, from the symmetry of the situation there is a 1/2 chance that you would continue as the copy or the original, but you would not experience both. The two versions of you would immediately diverge from the point the copy was created.
No. You would experience your own mind, the computer would experience its own mind, and this would be the case even if the experiences were identical.
Cool question. Very clever, and I do not know the answer. But if I were a normal person not a IT guy, (which I’m not), I would say yes.
